channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti high up but very very visible, 22nd June
item.description:
Graffiti high up on buildings above Poundland. This particular large tagging has been there for months. Please can landlords clear this up. It is very large and very visible and shame on Cheltenham Borough Council for not either instructing landlords to clear this up or dealing with it directly themselves. Graffiti is increasing in Cheltenham and along with dirty streets and weeds is making Cheltenham a disgrace. Re tagging surely the culprits are by the very nature of the tags identifying themselves?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds growing in front/ledge/roof of building in high street, 22nd June
item.description:
Messy weeds and vegetation growing on roof above ground level shop window on main high street. This has been steadily growing and getting worse for last few years! Who should clear this ? The shop leasing the building or the landlord/owner of the building ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 224/226, High Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Falling stones from wall onto pavement and road, 21st June
item.description:
Between the entrance to the path from sermon Street to Derwent Close up to the bus stop. Several stones have fallen from the wall and are loose. This is a risk to bus passengers and other pedestrians as well as a risk to vehicles on the road. Stones have been loose for several months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light is out ., 21st June
item.description:
Broken street light in Kingsmead Avenue post outside number 9, very dark on night., light is busted more than a month old now. Thamk you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Kingsmead Avenue, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Road diversion signs have been left, 21st June
item.description:
These signs have been left on the side of the road for at least six months. They make it tricky to cross the road. Sorry wasn' sure what category to put this under.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Folly Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Cyclists using footpath, there is no signage to say that cyclists shouldn’t use it., 21st June
item.description:
Cyclists using a footpath that is not a bridle way but a footpath. There is no signage to inform cyclists they shouldn’t use it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Bath Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Multiple potholes, 21st June
item.description:
In the middle of the road, between carriageways. Cars crossing from the junction to A40 fall into jarring craters. Won't be long before it breaks people's suspension/shocks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Telstar Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath ZCK 59 is completely overgrown and the path is not visible in some parts., 21st June
item.description:
The upper part of this footpath leading down to 15th tee on the golf course has become extremely overgrown and is dangerously so in some areas. The sign closing the path whilst the A435 was undergoing repairs is lying on the grass so it’s not clear if the path is still closed or not. If not the upper part of the footpath needs clearing before someone injures themselves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Very overgrown and dangerous missiomg handrail

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Abandoned road sign on cycle route behind Walls, 21st June
item.description:
On the cycle route behind Walls there is an abandoned temporary road. It is a potential hazard to the cycle route and needs to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinium Avenue, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public littering, 21st June
item.description:
When I walked out of my drive on Green Lane Hucclecote at 15:30 (approx) a lady in a black Mercedes reg S006PAR opened her car door and proceeded to place her McDonalds rubbish on the pavement before driving off. I asked the house adjacent if the person was visiting them but apparently just another random driver, the guy cleared up the rubbish but was really annoyed. I'm not sure if there is anything that can be done but this is happening too often and people seem to have lost any pride and conscience. Until someone is brought to book about this kind of behaviour I'm afraid it will continue and probably get worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Green Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Overgrown unkept tree, 21st June
item.description:
